item.title: Announcing Interop 2026
item.content:encoded: Exciting news for web developers, designers, and browser enthusiasts alike — Interop 2026 is here, continuing the mission of improving cross-browser interoperability.

item.title: Release Notes for Safari Technology Preview 237
item.content:encoded: Safari Technology Preview Release 237 is now available for download for macOS Tahoe and macOS Sequoia.

item.title: WebKit features for Safari 26.3
item.content:encoded: Safari 26.3 is here, with practical improvements for performance and user experience.

item.title: Interop 2025: A year of convergence
item.content:encoded: Interop 2025 has come to a close, and the results speak for themselves.

item.title: Release Notes for Safari Technology Preview 236
item.content:encoded: Safari Technology Preview Release 236 is now available for download for macOS Tahoe and macOS Sequoia.

item.title: When will CSS Grid Lanes arrive? How long until we can use it?
item.content:encoded: Anytime an exciting new web technology starts to land in browsers, developers want to know “when in the world am I going to be able to use this?” Currently, the finalized syntax for Grid Lanes is available in Safari Technology Preview.

item.title: New Safari developer tools provide insight into CSS Grid Lanes
item.content:encoded: You might have heard recently that Safari Technology Preview 234 landed the final plan for supporting masonry-style layouts in CSS.

item.title: Release Notes for Safari Technology Preview 235
item.content:encoded: Safari Technology Preview Release 235 is now available for download for macOS Tahoe and macOS Sequoia.

item.title: Release Notes for Safari Technology Preview 234
item.content:encoded: Safari Technology Preview Release 234 is now available for download for macOS Tahoe and macOS Sequoia.

item.title: Introducing CSS Grid Lanes
item.content:encoded: It’s here, the future of masonry layouts on the web!
